jobDescription: Data Analyst TROY, Michigan, United States Location: Remote. However, must be able to work onsite for initial training at 1960 RESEARCH DRIVE, SUITE 200, Troy, MI 48083  Maintains the General Motors Corporate Supplier Identification Source (CSIDS). This Database is set up to track all activity and supplier information globally. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES PROCESS CUSTOMER REQUESTS by reviewing data for deficiencies; resolving discrepancies by using standard procedures or returning inaccurate documents to the supervisor for resolution. VERIFIES INFORMATION by searching Dun & Bradstreet databases using established search criteria; identifying appropriate Duns for legal company name and address. PRODUCES INFORMATION by initiating telecommunications to verify supplier data if not identifiable in D & B. PREPARES SOURCE DATA FOR COMPUTER ENTRY by compiling and sorting information; establishing entry priorities. ENTERS SOURCE DATA by inputting alphabetic and numeric information according to CSIDS screen format and customer policies. MAINTAINS HISTORICAL RECORDS by documenting system changes and revisions and storing documentation for a three month period. REQUESTS INFORMATION AND UPDATES by contacting D & B via electronic mail; initiating investigation to update or establish supplier records. ENSURES CUSTOMER AND USER SATISFACTION by resolving open issues by providing instructional information as requested. MAINTAINS OPERATIONS by following policies and procedures; reporting needed changes. CONTRIBUTES TO TEAM EFFORT by accomplishing related results as needed. PREPARES ALL DESIGNATED CDI AND CUSTOMER PERSONNEL TO USE THE SYSTEM by conducting training sessions. MAINTAINS PROFESSIONAL AND TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE by attending educational workshops.DISCLAIMER: The above essential functions are a summarized list.
